intro: Elaphoglossum marquisearum var. tahuatense, commonly known as the Tahuatén fern, is a rare and specialized fern species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is characterized by its delicate, lanceolate fronds that are typically covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant exhibits a unique reproductive structure with spore-producing clusters arranged in a distinctive pattern. It thrives in humid, shaded environments with well-drained, acidic soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and climate change.
